Ivan Flores

Hey, I'm Ivan Flores, a Computer Science Junior at California State University, Fullerton. My goal is to be a Big Data Engineer, and I'm actively working towards that goal by interning with the Internal Services Department at LA County. Within my role as an intern, I am immersed with the development and documentation of two software solutions. Leading the back-end development and database design of a county wide web application has been really insigtful and tooling. I believe designing and implementing such solutions that support client needs and requests has given me a solid foundation of experience and value to carry over to my next venture. Let's connect and talk about how we can work together!

Experience

Technology Intern @ LA County-Internal Services Department

July 2023 - Present

- Leading a backend development team to create a robust .NET Mentorship platform.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams of interns to gather requirements, providing technical insights, and aligning development efforts with project goals.

- Spearheaded the development of a comprehensive county employee-wide leave of absence form, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and user-friendliness.

- Actively collaborate with a team of seasoned C# developers, participating in daily stand-ups, contributing to code base discussions, and engaging in collaborative problem-solving sessions, fostering a rich learning environment and contributing to the success of the development projects.

Emergency Medical Technician

March 2020 - July 2023

- Communicated sensitive data to hospital staff in very fast paced and high stress environments.

- Collaborated wtih teams of EMT's and Paramedics to provide the best care possible to patients.

- Formulated patient care plans and executed them in a timely manner.

Projects

C++: SQL Database Built From Scratch

Developed as a project for my Data Structures an Algorithm course, this console project utlilizes data structures such as B-Tree's, Linked Lists, Stacks, and Queues built from scrach down to the initial node. Algorithms implemented include Reverse Polish Notation, and Shunting Yard. A much enjoyed challenge.

Check it out on GitHub
Java: Stock and Crypto Portfolio Tracker

Built on the Spring Framework, this passion project was an introduction to Full-Stack Development. This project utilizes Alphavantage's financial API and a MYSQL Database. The frontend was built on HTML, CSS, JS, and AnyChart.js.

Check it out on GitHub
C++: Graphing Calculator

Built using the SFML library and self-developed data structures, this program utilizes the Reverse Polish Notation and the Shunting Yard Algorithms. Enter any equation and view its graph on the cartesian plane.

Check It out on GitHub
